meanings.definition: Gathered or grouped together in a cluster or mass.
meanings.sent1: The cat litter was designed for easy cleaning with its clumping properties.
meanings.sent2: The soil in the garden was clumping together after the rain.
meanings.sent3: The clumping socks in the laundry basket made it hard to find a matching pair.
meanings.sent4: The clumping clouds in the sky signaled an incoming storm.
meanings.sent5: The clumping leaves on the ground created a crunchy carpet underfoot.

meanings.definition: To form into clumps or clusters.
meanings.sent1: She was clumping the dough to make cookies for the bake sale.
meanings.sent2: The hikers' boots were clumping loudly on the rocky trail.
meanings.sent3: The kids were clumping together to form a human pyramid in the park.
meanings.sent4: The ingredients started clumping together in the mixing bowl.
meanings.sent5: The snow was clumping into perfect snowballs for a snowball fight.

meanings.definition: The act of grouping or clustering together.
meanings.sent1: The clumping of students near the entrance caused a traffic jam.
meanings.sent2: The clumping of stars in the night sky formed beautiful constellations.
meanings.sent3: The clumping of colors in the painting created a vibrant masterpiece.
meanings.sent4: The clumping of data points on the graph indicated a strong correlation.
meanings.sent5: The clumping of ants carrying food back to their nest was fascinating to watch.
